title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 people were rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Rescue involved crews from Lyme, Hanover, Thetford fire departments, and police from Lyme and Orford.
One skier was hospitalized; others were checked for injuries and returned to the lodge.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to 11 months in federal prison for obstruction and false statements.
Tran's new sentence largely concurrent with his 18-month sentence for fraudulently collecting pandemic unemployment benefits.
Tran pleaded guilty to multiple charges, including intimidating an elderly woman and stealing a firearm in separate incidents.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month after scoring eight goals, 14 points in 14 games for the Bruins.
Minten was acquired from the Maple Leafs and is the first Bruin to win Rookie of the Month since 2022.
Bruins to rely on young centers Minten, Khusnutdinov, and Poitras in Sunday’s game against the Lightning.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gloucester mourns seven crew members presumed dead after the Lily Jean, a 72-foot fishing vessel, sank off the coast.
Rescue efforts were suspended after a 24-hour search covering 1,000 square miles found one unresponsive body and an empty life raft.
Victims include Captain Gus Sanfilippo, Sean Therrien, John Paul Rousanidis, Jada Samitt, Paul Beal, Paul Beal Jr., and Freeman Short.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for the Stadium Series game against the Lightning in Tampa.
The attire, supplied by Boston Costume, featured tricorne hats, shoe buckles, and wigs, with personalized outfits for each player.
Ahead of the game, players carried a portable speaker playing Revolutionary War-era music as a tribute to local history.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade relief pitcher Jordan Hicks and pitching prospect David Sandlin to the White Sox.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and sends some cash to Chicago in the trade.
Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings in 2025 and has a contract through 2027.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Roadrunner hosts the first day of the two-day 'Something in the Way' festival featuring indie bands.
Ben Stas captures performances by bands like The Hotelier, Tigers Jaw, and Explosions in the Sky.
The festival includes a diverse range of indie music from emo to screamo across two dozen bands.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots fullback Jack Westover revealed his sister predicted a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup, winning $18,000.
Westover's sister bet $5 on the unlikely Super Bowl pairing during training camp, surprising many analysts.
Westover, a Washington native and former University of Washington player, joined Patriots' practice squad in 2024.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye spoke at the Patriots' send-off rally in Foxborough ahead of Super Bowl LX.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, recovering from illness and shoulder injury, received MVP chants from fans.
The Patriots will play the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium on February 8 at 6:30 p.m.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Actor Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live' on January 31, 2026.
Cardi B provided the musical performances for the episode, marking her appearance as the musical guest.
The episode featured a cameo by Pete Davidson and appearances by Stellan Skarsgård and Jack McBrayer.
